com.communote.server.api.core.image

Class ImageProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.api.core.image.ImageProvider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttachmentImageProvider, ClientImageProvider, EntityImageProvider, HttpExternalImageProvider, UserImageProvider

    public abstract class ImageProvider
extends Object
    An image provider loads the unscaled images for a certain image type described by an ImageTypeDescriptor.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageProvider

        public ImageProvider(String identifier,
                     String pathToDefaultImage)
        Create a new ImageProvider.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the provider. The identifier has to be unique among all providers that are registered for an image type.
        pathToDefaultImage - If the path starts with file: it is interpreted as a file URI otherwise it is interpreted as the name of a resource containing the default image. This resource will be loaded with the class loader of this class. If null, there will be no default image.

    • Method Detail

      • canLoad

        public abstract boolean canLoad(String imageIdentifier)
        Test whether a provider can load the image. This should for instance return false if the provider was disabled completely or partially for certain identifiers. Checking whether the identified image exists is not necessary because loadImage(String) will handle it.
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier of the image
        Returns:
        whether the image can be loaded

      • getDefaultImageMimeType

        public String getDefaultImageMimeType()
                               throws ImageNotFoundException
        Get the mime type of the default image
        Returns:
        the mime type
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - if there is no (valid) default image

      • getDefaultImageResourceLastModificationTimestamp

        protected long getDefaultImageResourceLastModificationTimestamp()
        Get the timestamp of the last modification of the default image resource. This method is used by getDefaultImageVersionString() when the default image exists and is resource that should be loaded with the class loader. This implementation returns the build-timestamp of the application.
        Returns:
        the timestamp of the last modification

      • getDefaultImageVersionString

        public String getDefaultImageVersionString()
                                    throws ImageNotFoundException
        The version string of the default image.
        Returns:
        the version string
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no default image
        See Also:
        getVersionString(String)

      • getIdentifier

        public String getIdentifier()
        Return the identifier of the provider. The identifier has to be unique among all providers that are registered for an image type.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the provider

      • getTimeToLive

        public int getTimeToLive()
        Get the number of seconds until a cached image should expire and thus be reloaded
        Returns:
        time to live in the cache

      • getVersionString

        public abstract String getVersionString(String imageIdentifier)
                                 throws AuthorizationException,
                                        ImageNotFoundException
        Return a string which represents the version of the image. Whenever an image is modified the version string should change. An example of a version string could be the timestamp of the last modification.
        This method is called by the image manager from a method with the same name. The method of the image manager is intended to be called during image URL creation to get an image URL reflecting the latest image version. Since an image URL is usually rendered along with other content, this method should return quickly. The actual image retrieval (download) one the other hand which is done by loadImage can take longer.
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier of the image
        Returns:
        the version string of the image.
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no image for the imageIdentifier
        AuthorizationException - in case the current user is not allowed to access the image

      • hasDefaultImage

        public boolean hasDefaultImage(String imageIdentifier)
        Return whether the provider has a default image for the case when there is no image for a given identifier. This implementation will return true if the resource identified by the constructor parameter pathToDefaultImage exists.
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier for which no image was found
        Returns:
        whether there is a default image

      • imageChanged

        public void imageChanged(String imageIdentifier)
        Invoked by the ImageManager.imageChanged(String, String, String) to notify the provider about a changed image. The provider can use this method to reset internal caches. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier of the changed image. Can be null in the case that all images have changed.

      • isAuthorized

        public abstract boolean isAuthorized(String imageIdentifier)
        Return whether the current user is allowed to access the given image.
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - identifier of the image
        Returns:
        True, if the user is allowed to access the image.

      • isExternalProvider

        public abstract boolean isExternalProvider()
        Return whether this provider loads image from an external resource (like another server) and not from the local database or file system.
        Returns:
        true, if it is a provider for external images

      • loadDefaultImage

        public Image loadDefaultImage()
                       throws ImageNotFoundException
        Load the default image.
        Returns:
        the default image
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no default image.

      • loadImage

        public abstract Image loadImage(String imageIdentifier)
                         throws ImageNotFoundException,
                                AuthorizationException
        Load the unscaled image
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - The identifier of the image
        Returns:
        The image.
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no image for the imageIdentifier or loading failed
        AuthorizationException - in case the current user is not allowed to access the image
